page.title: 13KINGSTON CHURCH
page.content: Kingston Church lies in the foot of the Downs in a deep long coombe. Protected by high ranges of hills. Kingston Church is an excellent example of a small country church in the "decorated" style, it's called ST PANCRAS after the Priory of Lewes. The present{VICAR is REV. GEORGE H.PATON who holds regular sevices.The church runs a choir and they have a Mothers' Union and a Monday Group and a Bible Study Group and a big flower festival in May. This is followed by a concert.This is a sample of the programme. The programme will consist of organ solos by Dr.BRYN BRIDGES and cello/viola sonatas (Bach); London Trio (Haydn); string trios (Mozart) played by Chamber Ensembles drawn from the East Sussex Youth Orchestra.
